instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Green Light (Ticking Noise)
threads.message:
Hi there,

New to this so bear with me...

I have a board that has no green light and will not power. It also makes a ticking noise.

I have put a new ISL on so far and tried a different magsafe board.

on PP3V42 i have = 3.481v which i assume is okay...
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is = 12.27v

On <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> pin 1 (<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>) i get 3.37v then it goes up to 3.4 then back down?

On <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> i get the same thing 3.37v then up to 3.4

Any ideas where i can go next?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Green Light (Ticking Noise)
threads.message: 12.27 volts on PPBUS would mean the SMC is not running. What do you get on <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and how does the <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> area look? Also history of the board liquid, drop, battery replacement etc?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Green Light (Ticking Noise)
threads.message: Thanks for the info - <CHIP>U5010</CHIP> looks good - PIN 5 <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.448 volts. History is apparently an iPhone charger was plugged in and it turned off. SMC Reset didn't work. Could this be the SMC affected?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Green Light (Ticking Noise)
threads.message: Don't use comments for future reference just because it's hard for Duke and Louis and all of us to see if you respond. If <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is high then your issue may be around the SMC. You are measuring with board only correct (no keyboard, trackpad etc plugged in)?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Green Light (Ticking Noise)
threads.message: Thanks - yes board only. Around the SMC looks okay, no red areas and no corrosion

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Green Light (Ticking Noise)
threads.message: What voltage did you have on PPBUS before you replaced the ISL? Could be bad soldering on the ISL causing it for sure, but if not, my guess would be SMC related issue.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Green Light (Ticking Noise)
threads.message: I was still getting 12.27v but I’ll double check the area again. Otherwise I’ll replace the SMC ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Green Light (Ticking Noise)
threads.message: Yep that's prob an SMC issue then worth a try on the ISL tho! Save lots of headache if it was the ISL lol

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Green Light (Ticking Noise)
threads.message: Okay good to know! - it’s at the back of the queue now lol but I will post an update after the SMC replacement

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Green Light (Ticking Noise)
threads.message:
Hi again - replaced the SMC and i'm still getting no green light...clicking noise has now stopped and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is still 12.26v.

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is still high

Any ideas?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Green Light (Ticking Noise)
threads.message: Bad SMC? Killed SMC while reballing? SMC is still not running. Did you get the SMC from an identical donor board?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B No Green Light (Ticking Noise)
threads.message: Tried another SMC and were on! Must have had a dodgy one. Thanks for the help!
